titleStmt.title: God's eye on the contrite, or, A discourse shewing that true poverty and contrition of spirit, and trembling at God's Word is the infallible and only way for the obtaining and retaining of divine acceptation as it was made in the audience of the General Assembly of the Massachusetts Colony at Boston in New England May 27, 1685, being the day of election there / by William Adams.
titleStmt.author: Adams, William, 1650-1685.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Richard Pierce for Samuel Sewall,

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: pages torn with loss of print. Page 2 lacking.
Title supplied from NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
